comments.html:
Making an SD.WAN really secure is a major challenge. The team from the SD-WAN New Hop(e) project did a tremendous job that required a lot of system, network and security knowledge.

This example shows that you can't even trust FIPS for proper cryptography anymore. The system described recently got new FIPS certification. This shows that the FIPS certification process is broken and FIPS certification is not a trustable indication for meeting basic security requirements anymore.

It also shows that most customers fail to do a proper due diligence before making purchase decisions or have a fairly high risk appetite. This includes companies active in PCI DSS- and HIPAA-regulated environments.
comments.name: Christoph Jaggi
